result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David S Sebastian

records.addlTxt:
Final status/scheduling conference on November 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[MK] case called at 12:03pm 
Defendant David S Sebastian appears by audio-only.  Attorney Cassi Nelson appears by Zoom video. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court verifies with Mr. Sebastian that he can hear the proceedings.  
Attorney Nelson indicates the matter is not resolved, so the scheduling of a jury trial is requested.
Mr. Sebastian makes a statement that he does not drive and he has a medical condition that makes coming to court difficult.  
On request of Attorney Nelson, the Court allows the Defense to appear by Zoom for the Final Status Conference.  
recess 12:06pm

NEXT:  (1) FSSC on November 22nd at 3:30pm, with the Defense allowed to appear by Zoom,  (2) Jury Trial on November 29th at 8:15am
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[MK] case called at 12:10pm. 
Defendant David S Sebastian appears by Zoom video, and then by audio-only. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears.  ADA Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Attorney Nelson cites Mr. Sebastian's significant health issues that limit his ability to meet with her; the scheduling of another status conference is requested.
recess 12:12pm

NEXT:  Status Conference on September 8th at 11:30am
OK [hearing on Thursday be converted to zoom]
Status conference on July 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[MK] case called at 10:10am 
Defendant David S Sebastian in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Nelson requests the scheduling of another status conference, indicating that she has received some follow up discovery after she had requested more information from the State; she needs to review that with Mr. Sebastian and also discuss the State's plea offer with him. 
recess 10:13am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on July 21st at 11:30am

Pre-trial conference on May 18, 2022 at 11:40 am.
Status conference on June 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 9:01am 
Defendant David S Sebastian in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson.   ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer Landon Muehlenkamp-sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Witt
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson 

Arguments given by ADA Witt

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Sebastian committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 9:17am  

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 5/18/22 at 11:40am(Witt)  (2) Status Conference on 6/17/22 at 10:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for David S Sebastian
Current: 3840 La Salle St, Racine, WI 53402 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2022)
Prior: 307 S. Sixth St, Watertown, WI 53094

[ma] Case called at 1:29 PM 
Defendant David S Sebastian appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth, updates address to: 3840 LaSalle in Racine, 53402
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $2500  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession of any dangerous weapons 

The Court finds probable cause to exist on the four corners of the complaint.
recess 1:33 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/22 at 8:30am   (2) Preliminary Hearing on 4/26/22 at 8:30am
